intro: [WRONG START] Pleurothillus supervacanea, commonly known as the pink-veined orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers with a distinctive pink and white coloration. It thrives in high humidity and partial shade, often growing on tree branches or rocky surfaces. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
